decision_conditions: <p>The development hereby granted must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the date this prior approval is granted. Reason: In accordance with Condition 3c of Class AA of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).<br></p>

<p>The developer must notify the local planning authority of the completion of the development as soon as reasonably practicable after completion; and that notification must be in writing and includeâ€”(i) the name of the developer;(ii) the address of the dwellinghouse; and(iii) the date of completion. Reason: In accordance with conditions 3(d) and 3(e) Class AA of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).<br></p>

<p>Prior to commencement, the developer must submit to the local planning authority for approval in writing a report for the management of the construction of the development, which sets out the proposed development hours of operation and how any adverse impact of noise, dust, vibration and traffic on adjoining owners or occupiers will be mitigated. Reason: To ensure effects are adequately managed to protect neighbouring amenity in accordance with condition 3(b) of Class AA of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended)<br></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.554; padding: 0pt 0pt 8pt;"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">The development shall be undertaken in full accordance with the conditions set out in the relevant part of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-79a9605a-7fff-90b0-f620-d2c03714b34e"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; line-height: 1.554;"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Reason: To comply with the requirements of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended)</span></p>
description: Prior approval application for the enlargement of a dwellinghouse by construction of an additional storey with a height of 2.8m above the original ridgeline and total height proposed of 10.4m
